page.title: 08DEVELOPMENT IN FORTHAMPTON
page.content: Forthampton's Parish Council meets irregularly throughout the year generally to discuss threats of impending development. Almost every building is of historic interest and feelings amongst local people are intense regarding preservation and change. The two barns of Corner House Farm were sympathetically renovated in 1983 but there has been controversy in 1985 over the building of two new houses between the barns and Brewers cottage. These houses are totally out of character with the village but local feeling was thwarted. The Estate has to be run along commercial lines and in this instance the locals feel that commerce has outmanoeuvred concern for harmony. Planning permission, with local support, has just been granted to fully restore Southfield House.
